column1: Unsafe shell command constructed from library input
column2: Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious user to change the meaning of the command.
column4: [["String concatenation"|"relative:///index.js:7:8:7:46"]] based on library input is later used in [["shell command"|"relative:///index.js:7:3:13:4"]].

column2: Forwarding command-line arguments to a child process executed within a shell may indirectly introduce command-line injection vulnerabilities.
column4: This command depends on an unsanitized [["command-line argument"|"relative:///cli.js:6:12:6:23"]].
